data.name: DeleteError
data.value: Failed to delete file: {0}

data.name: Description
data.value: This backend can read and write data to an SSH based backend, using SFTP. Allowed formats are "ssh://hostname/folder" or "ssh://username:password@hostname/folder".

data.name: DescriptionDebugToConsoleLong
data.value: The SSH backend relies on an external program (sftp) to work. Since the external program may change at any time, this may break the backend. Enable this option to get debug information about the ssh connection written to the console. Only used if the --use-sftp-application option is supplied.

data.name: DescriptionDebugToConsoleShort
data.value: Prints debug info to the console

data.name: DescriptionFTPPasswordLong
data.value: The password used to connect to the server. This may also be supplied as the environment variable "FTP_PASSWORD".

data.name: DescriptionFTPPasswordShort
data.value: Supplies the password used to connect to the server

data.name: DescriptionFTPUsernameLong
data.value: The username used to connect to the server. This may also be supplied as the environment variable "FTP_USERNAME".

data.name: DescriptionFTPUsernameShort
data.value: Supplies the username used to connect to the server

data.name: DescriptionSFTPCommandLong
data.value: The full path to the "sftp" application. Only used if the --use-sftp-application option is supplied.

data.name: DescriptionSFTPCommandShort
data.value: The path to the "sftp" program

data.name: DescriptionSshkeyfileLong
data.value: Points to a valid OpenSSH keyfile. If the file is encrypted, the password supplied is used to decrypt the keyfile. If this option is supplied, the password is not used to authenticate. This option only works when using the managed SSH client.

data.name: DescriptionSshkeyfileShort
data.value: Uses a SSH private key to authenticate

data.name: DescriptionSSHOptionsLong
data.value: Supply any extra commandline arguments, which are passed unaltered to the ssh application. Only used if the --use-sftp-application option is supplied.

data.name: DescriptionSSHOptionsShort
data.value: Extra options to the ssh commands

data.name: DescriptionTransferTimeoutLong
data.value: The SSH backend relies on an external program (sftp) to work. Since the external program may hang, Duplicati must use a timeout to detect a stall in the external program. Use this option to adjust the timeout. Minimum allowed value is one minute, maximum allowed is one hour. Only used if the --use-sftp-application option is supplied.

data.name: DescriptionTransferTimeoutShort
data.value: Sets the timeout for transfering a file

data.name: DescriptionUnmanagedLong
data.value: Set this flag to use the sftp command from --sftp-command to communicate with the server. Setting this flag also requires that --disable-streaming-transfers is set

data.name: DescriptionUnmanagedShort
data.value: Use an external sftp application

data.name: DisplayName
data.value: SSH based

data.name: DownloadTimeoutError
data.value: Timeout while downloading file

data.name: FolderNotFoundError
data.value: Folder not found: {0}, log: {1}

data.name: FolderNotFoundManagedError
data.value: Unable to set folder to {0}, error message: {1}

data.name: FolderVerificationError
data.value: Failed to validate the remote directory: {0}

data.name: HostNotAuthenticatedError
data.value: The host is not authenticated, please connect to the host using SSH, and then re-rerun Duplicati, log: {0}

data.name: IncorrectFileHeaderError
data.value: File must have the OpenSSH private key header, eg: ---- BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY ----

data.name: KeyfileNotFoundError
data.value: The supplied keyfile was not found: {0}

data.name: KeyfileParseError
data.value: Unable to parse content of the file. Please include the following information in a bug report (you may omit any key data present): {0}

data.name: LaunchErrorLinux
LaunchErrorWindows
PasswordMissingError
data.value: A password was expected, but passwordless login was specified

data.name: StreamingNotSupportedError
data.value: The SSH backend does not support streaming when using the unmanaged SSH backend, if you supply --use-sftp-application, you must also specify --disable-streaming-transfers

data.name: UnexpectedConnectionError
data.value: Unexpected error: {0}

data.name: UnexpectedExitResponseError
data.value: Got unexpected exit response

data.name: UnexpectedResponseError
data.value: Failed to get expected response to command: {0}

data.name: UnsupportedKeyfileEncryptionError
UploadTimeoutError
data.value: Timeout while uploading file

data.name: UsernameMissingError
data.value: A username was expected, but none was supplied

data.name: DescriptionSshnocdLong
data.value: Disable the use of the cd command. This is used to support SSH backends where the cd/pwd is broken. If this option is enabled all paths will be transmitted with full paths.

data.name: DescriptionSshnocdShort
data.value: Do not use the cd command
